alert.note: Alert for Vernon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 22 at 3:31PM CDT until March 25 at 8:42AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri... Little Osage River near Horton affecting Vernon County. For the Little Osage River Basin...including Horton, Fulton...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Little Osage River near Horton. * WHEN...Until Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 41.0 feet, minor flooding affects low lying areas near the gage site and farmland along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 41.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:45 PM CDT Tuesday was 41.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 42.4 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 41.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 42.4 feet on 02/01/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday afternoon at 345 PM CDT.
